resources.string: Do you want to set an alarm for this course?

This specialization aims to graduate qualified professionals in the study and design of projects and infrastructure such as buildings, roads, water networks, sewage systems, bridges, tunnels, dams, and railways.

This specialization aims to prepare engineers specializing in essential electrical equipment such as generators, transformers, and motors, focusing on electrical circuits, technologies, design, protection circuits, high voltage insulation techniques required for them, control, operation, and equipment linking to form the power station. It covers stages of production, conversion, transmission, and distribution of electrical energy.

Mechatronics is a discipline that combines electrical engineering, mechanical engineering, and computer engineering. It aims to provide students with knowledge and understanding of the working systems, applications, and control methods of each specialization. Mechatronics engineers are responsible for integrating the entire system and producing a comprehensive control system capable of solving a wide range of electrical, mechanical, and software problems, enabling them to lead multiple design teams.

This specialization aims to prepare engineers specialized in technical management of production lines, monitoring and controlling manufacturing operations, shaping and operating on lathes, milling machines, welding, operating modern machinery, as well as the ability to handle industrial problems, solve them, and manage work teams.
This field deals with controlling the environment by managing temperature, humidity, and air movement inside a conditioned space to achieve a suitable indoor environment.

This specialization enables students to comprehend essential concepts in automotive principles through laboratories and workshops, familiarizing them with various vehicle systems based on physical principles and safety considerations in vehicles. It covers diagnosis, maintenance, repair, service of vehicles, and familiarity with various electronic systems in them, allowing students to perform vehicle maintenance and service.

This specialization aims to prepare graduates in construction, mineral resources, environmental and water sectors. It includes teaching applied geology, geotechnology, geophysics, surface and groundwater, metallic and non-metallic information systems, and their economic evaluation.

This specialization focuses on industrial processes such as petrochemicals, fertilizers, and pharmaceuticals. Chemical engineers convert low-cost raw materials into valuable products, applying practical applications of chemistry, physics, and mathematics. It involves designing various devices like chemical reactors, refining towers, absorption, separation, and heat exchangers.

This specialization aims to equip students with knowledge in mineral exploration, evaluating deposits in terms of size, mineral concentration, and efficient extraction and processing methods that are safe for humans and the environment, with the best economic return. It covers geology, minerals, rocks, surface and underground mining, drilling and blasting techniques, rock and soil mechanics, and processing metallic and non-metallic ores.

This specialization aims to prepare engineers specializing in designing and maintaining various computer applications such as network building, software, databases, internet applications, industrial control systems, protection systems, digital communications, and expert systems. It focuses on analysis, evaluation, measurement, design, testing, production, and maintenance of computer materials, devices, and systems.

This specialization aims to provide students with theoretical and practical skills to engage in professions related to communications and electronics engineering. It involves studying various designs of digital and analog communication circuits, analyzing and controlling communication networks in terms of reading and analyzing information, and ensuring their stability.

This specialization aims to graduate engineers capable of dealing with renewable energy systems and their impact on the traditional electrical grid. It combines the ability to handle both traditional and renewable energy systems and integrate them within the electrical grid.

This specialization aims to keep pace with the Fourth Industrial Revolution in the field of artificial intelligence, automated control and protection systems, and autonomous systems. It equips graduates with the necessary engineering knowledge and skills in areas such as control systems, smart programming, computer vision, machine learning, data mining, and analysis.

This specialization aims to prepare students through theoretical and practical courses in organic chemistry, inorganic chemistry, physical chemistry, analytical chemistry, industrial chemistry, preparation of organic compounds, separation of natural compounds, electrochemistry, environmental studies, water research, metalloorganic chemistry, biochemical compounds, colloid chemistry, pharmaceutical chemistry, surface chemistry, and environmental pollutants. It is one of the fundamental sciences.

This specialization explores various scientific fields such as organic, inorganic, physical, and analytical chemistry from theoretical and laboratory perspectives, with practical applications in the manufacturing and analysis of chemical compounds in various fields such as pharmaceuticals, polymers, and industrial chemistry.

This specialization focuses on preparing scientifically qualified personnel in theoretical and applied physics. It meets the needs of students in general physics, classical mechanics, modern physics, quantum mechanics, electromagnetism, thermal dynamics, atomic and nuclear physics, mathematical physics, solid-state physics, molecular physics, optics, and astronomy. Students acquire skills and abilities in handling precision instruments, computers, plasma physics, lasers, medical physics, semiconductor physics, forming the basis of applied sciences.

Mathematics is defined as the study of measurement, calculation, and geometry. This specialization focuses on developing students abilities in solving mathematical problems and influencing the outcomes of these solutions. Mathematics is the cornerstone of all other scientific subjects and is fundamental to technological, medical, economic, and educational advancements.

This specialization aims to equip students with skills and knowledge related to biochemistry, genetics, molecular biology, cell biology, parasitology, animal and plant physiology, immunology, microbiology, plant classification, and environment.

This specialization aims to provide students with a theoretical and applied background in the financial system, including project financing, real estate financing, economic and financial feasibility studies. It also equips them with practical aspects of granting loans and market manipulation in financial and monetary markets. Moreover, it covers financial aspects related to joint-stock companies and banks, preparing students with skills for investing in financial markets through stocks, bonds, and portfolio formation.

This specialization focuses on studying how economic units operate and prepares economists interested in optimizing scarce economic resources such as capital and raw materials, and how to produce and distribute them within society. Students are provided with information on economic analysis, economic problems, concepts of national income, economic models, and analytical tools. They also learn about public revenues and expenditures, and the impact of surplus or deficit on state budgets.

This major aims to impart specialized managerial and practical concepts in human resources management, business administration, and organizational management. It enables graduates to manage private projects and work in institutions as managers, directors, and leaders.

Accounting is the language of finance and commerce, involving the classification, recording, transfer, summarization, and organization of financial transactions in a readable form for internal and external users. Accounting is used in all types of large, medium, and small companies.

This specialization aims to graduate and qualify students in the computerization of information systems in various fields such as accounting, finance, administration, medicine, etc. Its goal is to develop students abilities in planning, designing, implementing, developing, and managing information systems that serve various institutions such as banks, universities, and hospitals.

This program offers strong theoretical foundations and practical training to prepare qualified specialists with the necessary knowledge and skills in the field of mobile computing. Due to the scarcity of specialists in this field, the program aims to meet the needs of the local and regional technology market. It aims to train qualified experts with the necessary knowledge of concepts related to analyzing, designing, developing, maintaining, and managing mobile applications.

This specialization aims to provide students with fundamental knowledge and specific techniques in data science and practical foundations for using data science technologies in enterprise management and efficiency enhancement. Students learn how to think about data in a general work context, organize it, examine it to develop realistic business solutions and models. The program provides strong theoretical grounding and practical training to prepare qualified specialists with the knowledge and skills necessary to handle big data statistically, from data collection to refinement, classification, analysis, deriving information and knowledge from it, and utilizing it for accurate and scientific decision-making. The program also aims to equip students with machine learning concepts and train them to use them in data analysis, provide them with artificial intelligence concepts, train them in using its principles in data analysis, and provide them with the necessary skills to build future prediction models and use them to solve problems faced by government and private institutions, increasing their productivity and efficiency.

A cybersecurity bachelor’s degree is another entry-level program, but this degree lasts four years instead of two and provides a more comprehensive foundation in cybersecurity.Students develop fundamental IT skills through coursework in programming, data analytics, information security and risk management. Graduates often go on to work as cybersecurity engineers, information security analysts and network engineers.

Examine how operating systems and design have evolved as changes in hardware and software led to contemporary operating systems. Topics include basic OS concepts, methods of OS design and construction, process coordination, management, and algorithms for CPU scheduling, memory, and general resource allocation.

Course Description: In this course, students are introduced to the fundamental theories and concepts of human computer interaction (HCI). HCI is an interdisciplinary field that integrates theories and methodologies across many domains including cognitive psychology, neurocognitive engineering, computer science, human factors, and engineering design. Students will gain theoretical knowledge of and practical experience in the fundamental aspects of human perception, cognition, and learning as relates to the design, implementation, and evaluation of interfaces. Topics covered include: interface design, usability evaluation, universal design, multimodal interfaces (touch, vision, natural language and 3-D audio), virtual reality, and spatial displays. In addition to lectures, students will work on individual and team assignments to design, implement, and evaluate various interactive systems and user interfaces based on knowledge culled from class material and additional research.
The purpose of this course is to introduce the student to software engineering techniques, requirements engineering, software specification, software development and management of software projects.

This course presents the concept of Cloud Computing. Students will learn the technical meaning of Cloud Computing, its characteristics, and the different models of Cloud computing. Students will practice a set of cloud tools, services, platforms, etc. Students will be able to build, consume, configure, and maintain some cloud services and tools, and employ them to construct real cloud-based systems and applications.

This course explores key concepts and essential technologies of computer networks and broad range of topics in networking, including: General overview: networks applications, network classifications nd topologies, network layers, channel performance measures, transmission media, communication network protocols and architecture; data link layer: framing, error detection and correction, CSMA/CD, LAN IEEE standards; Network layer: IP service model, IP Addressing, subnetting, host configuration DHCP, ARP Protocol, ICMP protocol; Transport layer: UDP protocol, TCP protocol, TCP reliable transfer and sliding window, TCP flow and congestion control; application layer: DNS protocol, NAT protocol, HTTP protocol, persistent and non-persistent HTTP connection.

This course offers the opportunity for students to learn a set of techniques that are used to develop modern web applications. The course targets the evelopment process of Server-Side Web applications. Students will learn how to plan, manage, organize, and implement a complete web application using state-of-the-art tools and techniques like ASP.NET, Web API, and programming business logic using C# language.

In this course, students will learn the main GUI elements, and learn how to design GUIs for Windows desktop applications and write C# codes. The principles of Object-oriented Model will be revised and employed in this course to build-up and implement example applications and case studies. In addition, topics like exception handling, user input validation, and others will be taught as well.

This course introduces students to advanced programming technologies, design, and development related to mobile applications. Topics include accessing device capabilities, industry standards, perating systems, and programming for mobile applications using an OS Software Development Kit (SDK). In this course, students will learn to design applications for mobile and wearable devices, taking into account the limitations introduced by the nature of these devices, use tools such as App Inventor Develop for application programming, and implement applications through the use of SDKs such as the Android SDK. User interface and user experience will be discussed and application development guidelines from various vendors will be discussed and analysed. Lastly, the course will look at some current research in mobile computing.

This course is an introductory course on data mining. It introduces the basic concepts, principles, methods, implementation techniques, and applications of data mining, with a focus on three major ata mining functions: (1) pattern discovery and (2) Classification and (3) cluster analysis. It also gives an introduction to data warehousing and data acquisition and pre-processing, dimensionality reduction and outlier detection.

This course covers fundamental concepts of database systems. These concepts include database modelling and design, relational databases, querying and SQL, query optimization, and data storage. any additional key database topics from the design and application-building perspective are also covered, including indexes, views, transactions, and integrity constraints.

Wireless networks and their basic operation, different types of wireless technologies and systems, the basics of how they operate, different types of wireless voice, data nd broadcast services, key commercial systems. Wi-Fi wireless networks, Bluetooth wireless technology, GSM cellular networks, cellular internet access via Wireless access protocol (WAP), GPRS and UMTS networks, wireless networks operating system; Android OS, iOS, Mobile IP and Mobile routing, Transport layer over wireless networks, Mobile wireless network applications.

This course provides a pragmatic and hands-on introduction to the Python programming language, with a focus on practical applications, projects, and the skills necessary to analyze problems. This course covers topics including the basics (variables and data types, Control Structures, repetition Structures, and functions), data structures such as Lists and Tuples, Object- Oriented Programming (classes, inheritance, and polymorphism), iterators and geneators, regular expressions, lambda, file Input and Output, and dictionaries. The course also contains a lab
component for program testing and debugging.

In this course, students will learn the basic web development process using HTML. Then they will learn how to enhance and format web page contents by applying CSS rules. Finally, they will learn how to program with Java Script (JS) language to improve web pages functionality. In addition,they will learn how to utilize and make use of some frameworks like Bootstrap, and how to deal with IDE tools like VS Code® and Atom.

This course provides an introduction to artificial intelligence (AI) and the scope and applications of AI. Topics include problem-solving by searching, game techniques, propositional logic, first-order logic, uncertainty, and Bayesian networks. Besides, it covers Prolog programming.

resources.string: Tafila Technical University was established in 2005, being the ninth official university and the first technical university in the Hashemite Kingdom of Jordan.
The total area of the university is 77,550 square meters, extending in the heart of the Al-Ays area.

University Colleges: The university has six colleges: Engineering, Science, Information and Communication Technology, Business, Educational Sciences, and Arts. Additionally, there are two deanships: Student Affairs, and Scientific Research and Graduate Studies.
Study Programs: Bachelors, General Diploma, Intermediate Diploma, and Masters.
Address: Tafila Technical University PO Box 179, 66110 Tafila Jordan
